=E5=9C=A82008-12-16=EF=BC=8C"David Saff" <david@...> =E5=86=
=99=E9=81=93=EF=BC=9A


I think there is an existing bug.

I take it that m=
aven does the hierarchical suite construction for you?

David Saff

On Tue,=
 Dec 16, 2008 at 3:29 AM, Fredrik Wendt <fredrik@...> wrote:

> m=C3=
=A5n 2008-12-15 klockan 21:36 -0500 skrev David Saff:
> > Fredrik,
> >
> > =
I had forgotten DirectorySuiteBuilder. In general, I really like having a
>=
 > single class that describes the tests I want to run--it makes things muc=
h
> > easier when I want to run things from the command line, or ant, or my=

> > continuous build, or...
> >
> > David Saff
>
> Well, this project curr=
ently has 12 maven modules (plus som packaging
> modules) and it's far easi=
er just to have a naming convention that
> everyone sticks to and have the =
framework do the rest.
> Putting tests into a TestSuite class is considered=
 just administration
> overhead that adds no value to the project.
>
> I gu=
ess we'll have to put two DirectorySuiteBuilder classes in each
> module th=
at has unit and integration tests.
>
> Thanks for your replies.
>
> Still o=
pen for suggestions like "you could easily fix the eclipse plugin
> by look=
ing at the files in org.eclipse.....". :)
> Perhaps I should go about and f=
ile a bug/request report (or vote for an
> existing one).
>
> /
> Fredrik
